You lame ass fuck'r!

Windows 8 has reached its final development milestone. Build 9200 is complete and has been released to manufacturing, and Microsoft has published a full timetable for when people will be able to get their hands on it.

    August 15: MSDN and TechNet subscribers will be the first to get access to the new software.
    August 16: Software Assurance customers and Microsoft Partner Network members will get access to the operating system.
    August 20: Microsoft Action Pack providers will be given Windows 8.
    September 1: Volume license customers not using Software Assurance will be able to purchase Windows 8 licenses.
    October 26: Retail copies of Windows 8 and PCs and tablets (including Microsoft's own Surface tablet) will go on sale.

The final version of Visual Studio 2012 will also be available from August 15.

Windows 8's server counterpart, Windows Server 2012, has also reached the RTM milestone.

I'm just confirming that this is the real deal, and it works perfectly. I'm on it now.  This is Windows 8 PRO build 9200 x64 and x86.  Ok here's a few tips cause I struggled with it too.  If you use the activator in this release it activates windows but it doesn't allow you to personalize (change lock screen etc) they're greyed out but if you use a different method to activate windows credit from another post from "murphy78"

Mouse down to bottom left corner. Right click on the Start/desktop button.
Click "Command Prompt (Admin)" and type in these 3 commands at the command prompt:

slmgr /ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4
slmgr -skms kms.creighton.edu
slmgr -ato

If you do this it activates windows, and you can personalize it as well. WORKS PERFECT, nice release!!!!              Thanks again JBiz1

Installed just fine all features are working, remove the directory "Activation and Keys" Use PowerISO for this....then burn it using On the fly settings also using poweriso. Once thats done reboot your PC boot up the installer install it. If you want a dual boot then you must partition your HD or use another HD. Im running Win 7 and Win 8 off of 2 different HD's. After this you need to activate it like this for all features: 
Mouse down to bottom left corner. Right click on the Start/desktop button.
Click "Command Prompt (Admin)" and type in these 3 commands at the command prompt:

slmgr /ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4
slmgr -skms kms.creighton.edu
slmgr -ato

(I did not use the activator on my HD install, I used it with my VM install)

Im now activated and have installed the updates!

For everyone looking to update and are getting the "Use the other installation disc that says 64-bit" error, go to the Windows 8 DVD folder, go to sources and run the file called setup.exe. Dont ask how i figured it out, it was just trial and error lol.
If you just want to do a fresh install search google on how to make a bootable usb, use the windows 7 usb dvd tool(works the same with this iso) or simply burn the iso to a disk and boot from the disk, you will not encounter any errors if you simply want to do a fresh install.

How to activate via phone:

1.    Run CMD as admin. Copy or type:
slmgr /ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4

Close CMD and go to next step.

2.Press windows button + R and type slui 4. Press enter. Select United Kingdom as your country.

3.Call the toll free number. Follow their instructions. Works best with a real phone, but if you can't call internationally, use Skype or iCall.
+4408000188354

4. If they ask about number of computer, where you will use this key, say 1. Follow their instructions.

5.After that it's activated...permanently

OK. So here's the deal -- in case you noobs haven't understood it.

You can either install Win8 on a virgin computer (usually a virtual one) or you can "upgrade" your present Windows install -- using SETUP in the Win8 distribution -- but not this one!.

If you want to "upgrade", this is not what you want! At least not if you are running a 64 system. I haven't tested yet if it works on a 32 system, but I doubt that it will...
